name: ContentSizeCategory
desc: The sizes that you can specify for content.DeprecatedUse DynamicTypeSize instead.

items.name: init?(UIContentSizeCategory)
items.desc: Create a size category from its UIContentSizeCategory equivalent.

items.name: static var allCases: [ContentSizeCategory]
items.desc: A collection of all values of this type.

items.name: typealias AllCases
items.desc: A type that can represent a collection of all values of this type.

items.name: var isAccessibilityCategory: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value indicating whether the content size category is one that is associated with accessibility.

items.name: static func == (ContentSizeCategory, ContentSizeCategory) -> Bool
items.desc: Indicates whether two content size categories are equal.

items.name: static func != (Self, Self) -> Bool
items.desc: Indicates whether two content size categories are unequal.

items.name: static func < (ContentSizeCategory, ContentSizeCategory) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is less than that of the second argument.

items.name: static func <= (ContentSizeCategory, ContentSizeCategory) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is less than or equal to that of the second argument.

items.name: static func > (ContentSizeCategory, ContentSizeCategory) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is greater than that of the second argument.

items.name: static func >= (ContentSizeCategory, ContentSizeCategory) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the value of the first argument is greater than or equal to that of the second argument.

items.name: func hash(into: inout Hasher)
items.desc: Hashes the essential components of the content size category by passing them into the given hash function.

items.name: var hashValue: Int
items.desc: The hashed value of the content size category.
